Entries.default: As the bright glow approaches, the rhythm of a heartbeat - not your own - thumps in your head. The light coalesces into the muscular features of a hulking aumaua striding towards you.
"I wanted tougher, but you will suffice!"
"Who are you?"
"Come closer and say that again."
"Sorry, but what?"
[Say nothing.]

"Listen better!"

Heat roils from the spirit.
"Who are you? I am the Slayer, the fastest and the strongest."
"The Crucible has caught us a feisty Watcher? Good! What lies ahead is not for the meek."
"Return your trophy to the old man. There is much left ahead of you to hunt."
"Another, a woman in robes, also revealed herself to me."
"I met someone like you in the valley of the boars."
"I'm not here to speak of her. Let her seek elsewhere!"
"I'm not here to speak of him! He lived forever and accomplished nothing!"
"Oh gods!" The spirit shrinks away from the glow with a terrified yelp.
"Watcher!" the soul roars as if in challenge. He points a thick, gloved finger at you.
The soul laughs scornfully, flaring bright violet.
"That you had to ask speaks ill of your mind."
The lines of his face lose what definition they possessed, blurring into a featureless mass until the entirety of his form evaporates into thin air.
"Well. Wasn't he fun?"
"And far more to kill."
"Any idea who that was?"
"He seems to want us to kill someone. Or something."
"Let's go."
"He suggested he was the Slaying Face. Or at least the Slayer."
"Hard to say. He certainly wasn't nice, was he?"
"I wonder if we'll run into more like him if we continue with these trials. Hmm."
"Do you think this is why Galawain didn't want you here? Maybe this Slayer wants you to kill the gods!"
"Poor attitude aside, he knew of Engari, and he knew what you're up to."
"You should be careful."
"So what do you want?"
